image.altText: Pedestrians

props.synopsis: Australia's economy is growing at its slowest pace in decades, with government support keeping households afloat.

title.children: 'Weak growth with inflation uncomfortably high': Economy growing at slowest pace in decades, despite big government spending

image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest bank has paused its plans to charge customers a $3 fee to withdraw their own money at bank branches around the country, a day after it was announced.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank pauses plans to charge customers $3 fee to withdraw cash

image.altText: Man in dark suit standing talking.

props.synopsis: The federal government's decision to back a United Nations resolution urging Israel's withdrawal from Gaza was an attempt to win back votes going to the Greens, the opposition leader claims.

title.children: Demand for Israel to withdraw from Gaza made to win 'green votes', Peter Dutton claims

image.altText: A court sketch of Perry Koroumbilis

props.synopsis: Nearly 48 years after two women were stabbed to death in their Melbourne home, the man accused of carrying out the killings has been charged and faced court for the first time.

title.children: Easey Street accused faces court charged with murder, rape over 1977 killings

image.altText: Police holding a line out the front of a parliament building as people try to push their way through

props.synopsis: South Korea's main opposition party has announced it will initiate impeachment proceedings against President Yoon Suk Yeol unless he resigns, after he declared martial law. Follow live.

title.children: South Korean opposition threatening impeachment after president's shock martial law declaration

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Impeachment motion filed by opposition MPs
Impeachment bill to be tabled later today: reports
Insurrection charges to be brought against Yoon and other officials

image.altText: A group of Korean parliamentarians holding signs with red text and holding up their fists.

props.synopsis: For some of the Korean diaspora in Australia, the sudden declaration of martial law evoked memories of a dark past.

title.children: 'What is he thinking?': Korean Australians in complete shock over martial law chaos

image.altText: A tv screen showing a man speaking on the news

props.synopsis: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol has two options, according to his opposition — resign, or be impeached. Here's what the next 72 hours could look like.

title.children: South Korea's president could be facing impeachment in coming hours. Here's how it works

image.altText: Alan Jones leaves Day Street police station on bail with lawyer Bryan Wrench, Christopher Murphy

props.synopsis: Court documents have shed slightly more light on the historical charges laid against broadcaster Alan Jones, including allegations he touched or fondled complainants' genitals and squeezed bottoms.

title.children: Court documents reveal more details about historical charges laid against broadcaster Alan Jones

image.altText: A man and woman taking a selfie on a beach.

props.synopsis: The teenager, who is now 19, was free to leave court after being sentenced for lesser offences.

title.children: Teenager acquitted of Queensland Boxing Day murder released after sentencing for lesser offences

image.altText: Two serious-looking men outdoors.

props.synopsis: Trevor Lennox was told his wife had been sexually abused by a Queensland government aged care worker. After speaking out, Mr Lennox was accused of the same thing.

title.children: Family 'slurred as abusers' after exposing aged care sex predator scandal

image.altText: An unidentified pregnant woman.

props.synopsis: The Filippino surrogates were convicted on charges relating to selling, buying or exchanging a person for cross-border transfer.

title.children: Pregnant Filipino women jailed in Cambodia for acting as surrogates for baby trafficking ring

image.altText: A news anchorwoman at the start of a package on the Spirit of Tasmania with the words 'Ferry Fiasco' behind her.

props.synopsis: It'll cost at least $47,534 a week, plus costs, for the Spirit of Tasmania IV to berth in Scotland under a 30-day deal struck by the Tasmanian government.

title.children: Scottish media mark arrival of Spirit of Tasmania ferry 'too big' for Australia as cost revealed

image.altText: A woman cradles her newborn child in a hospital.

props.synopsis: Louisianna Chungulla will have an interesting story to tell – and an usual place of birth on her official documentation – after some fast work by the RFDS at Broome International Airport.

title.children: Baby born on airport tarmac two minutes after landing in WA's far north

image.altText: Zhalin Cecil works with young boys at risk of perpetrating violence.

props.synopsis: Experts say comprehensive one-on-one early intervention programs are having positive outcomes for young males at risk of becoming adults perpetrators of family violence.

title.children: 'I became the bully of bullies': Violence in childhood can lead boys to become violent men

image.altText: A sign on a supermarket shelf.

props.synopsis: Workplace Relations Minister Murray Watt urges Woolworths and the United Workers Union to reach an agreement to bring an end to industrial action which has led to stock shortages on supermarket and liquor store shelves.

title.children: Government urges Woolworths and union to end dispute now affecting Dan Murphy's

image.altText: A selfie of a man with his face blurred

props.synopsis: Anne and a man she had met online messaged every day for weeks. Their chat history shows how scammers emotionally and psychologically manipulated her — and stole $46,000.

title.children: 'You've destroyed me': A 'pig butchering' scam drained a 26-year-old Australian of $46,000

image.altText: Delegates sit in a semi-circle shape and look at a large stage and screens.

props.synopsis: Australia changes its position to support a UN resolution demanding "Israel bring to an end its unlawful presence in the Occupied Palestinian Territory as rapidly as possible".

title.children: Australia backs UN resolution calling for end to Israel's presence in Occupied Palestinian Territory

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: The 2024 NAPLAN school ranking results are out. The Australian Curriculum Assessment and Reporting Authority (ACARA) says they aren't a reliable measure of success.

title.children: Have you seen lists ranking top school NAPLAN results? Here's why they can be 'misleading'

image.altText: man with face mask.

props.synopsis: Neville Joseph Knight abused boys he had met while working as a boxing coach and youth worker at different PCYCs in regional NSW between 1967 and 2003.

title.children: Former youth worker who abused 11 boys over four decades sentenced to 18 years' jail

image.altText: A green sign says Lochern National Park on red sand with trees and blue sky behind.

props.synopsis: Council workers were excavating a gravel pit near Longreach in Queensland when they came across a human skull which traditional custodians say will remain in place.

title.children: Human skull believed to be historical Indigenous remains found in outback

image.altText: A young man in a green shirt wearing sunglasses leaving a courthouse

props.synopsis: It is alleged the 20-year-old man assaulted four different women in the Buderim, Sippy Downs and Mountain Creek areas between August and November.

title.children: Man accused of sexually assaulting women while they exercised on the Sunshine Coast faces fresh charge

image.altText: A man in police uniform stands next to a crashed plan in the bush.

props.synopsis: The cocaine, which had a street value of $800 million at the time, was found near a remote air strip north of Port Moresby.

title.children: Police destroy 500kg of cocaine seized after alleged 'black flight' from PNG to Australia crashed

image.altText: People waiting in line to view a rental property

props.synopsis: Experts say while it does look like the market is cooling, any decrease in prices is still a long way off for renters.

title.children: Some Australians pay 'critically unaffordable' rents as the market shows signs of cooling

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt standing in a gym.

props.synopsis: Clifford Neumann will spend more than 20 years in jail after planning and carrying out the murder of mother-of-five Victoria Stewart.

title.children: Clifford Neumann sentenced to 20 years in jail for murdering Victoria Stewart

image.altText: Trump walks out of a courtroom with a drawn expression, flanked by police officers and lawyers

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's legal team have filed paperwork requesting the hush money charges against the president-elect be dismissed, citing President Joe Biden's recent pardon of his son, Hunter.

title.children: Trump's lawyers point to Hunter Biden pardon in push to dismiss hush money case

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy standing at a lectern and looking up.

props.synopsis: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy flies into the remote community of Milikapiti on Melville Island after three officers were attacked during an arrest, leaving one unconscious.

title.children: NT police commissioner flies into remote community after officers attacked

image.altText: Close up of dairy heifer in crate for air export

props.synopsis: The cattle have arrived in Jakarta for Indonesia's new school lunch program. The country's new president has vowed to give all students free lunches and milk through the program, which is set to cost billions of dollars.

title.children: Fifty Aussie dairy cows flown to Indonesia for country's ambitious free school lunch program

image.altText: Raina Cruise wearing sunglasses outdoors

props.synopsis: Raina Cruise has been given a good behaviour bond for assaulting a police officer and two security guards while "particularly fired-up" after attending an anti-COVID vaccination rally in 2021.

title.children: Failed senate candidate avoids immediate jail for assaulting police officer, security guards

image.altText: Jack Doohan of Australia standing in the F1 paddock, leaning over a railing, looking over his left shoulder

props.synopsis: Australia's newest F1 driver, Jack Doohan, has his debut brought forward by three months, with the son of a motorcycle legend racing in this weekend's season finale.

title.children: With millions of dollars on the line, Alpine goes all-in on Aussie Jack Doohan

image.altText: A woman stands on a road caked with mud in front of a destroyed home after a flood

props.synopsis: More than 30 people have been killed in the flooding which was caused by heavy rains in the region in the past week, with communities facing a significant rebuild also preparing for more rain this weekend.

title.children: Deadly flooding in Malaysia and southern Thailand sees people urged to reconsider travel

image.altText: Tamika Upton of the Knights passes the football during an NRLW match

props.synopsis: Superstar fullback Tamika Upton has signed a three-year contract to return to Brisbane, in a huge coup for the perennial NRLW heavyweights.

title.children: NRLW superstar Tamika Upton returns to Brisbane Broncos

image.altText: Tahlia McGrath playing a cut shot while batting for Australia

props.synopsis: Tahlia McGrath is not in caretaker mode ahead of her first full series in charge of Australia's women's cricket team.

title.children: McGrath ready to make her mark as Australian captain against India

image.altText: Jasleen Kaur, with shoulder length brown hair and red, white and green scarf with 'divest' written on it, smiles widely.

props.synopsis: Scottish Indian artist Jasleen Kaur has won the UK's most prestigious art award, the Turner Prize, amid calls for the Tate to cut ties with organisations linked to Israel.

title.children: Winner of UK's most prestigious art prize calls for Gaza ceasefire in her acceptance speech

image.altText: A paper list of household costs, with money and a coffee on the side of the paper.

props.synopsis: Would you ask your children to pay to stay at home? As many Australians navigate tricky conversations about cost of living pressures, some say it needs to start with an open and honest discussion about household finances.

title.children: Parents debate if teenagers should pay board as more stay home for longer

image.altText: A person in military clothing stands near a man on his knees withy his hands behind his head and a young girl.

props.synopsis: The President of Belarus is engaged in a battle with the European Union, and refugees have become political pawns. This film dramatises the very real horrors faced by people caught hopelessly in the middle.

title.children: The Green Border is a lush forest on the Belarus-Poland border. It's also the site of a refugee crisis
